intro: Cupania candicans, commonly known as the white-flowered cupania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Cupania candicans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
